interrogation_framework.description: Comprehensive question database for systematic hypothesis validation

categories_list.name: Falsifiability
categories_list.description: Can the hypothesis be proven wrong?
questions: What specific prediction does this hypothesis make that could be proven false?
What experimental outcome would definitively falsify this hypothesis?
Are there observable consequences that distinguish this from alternative explanations?
Can you design a critical experiment that could disprove this?
What data would force you to abandon this hypothesis?
Is this hypothesis testable with current technology?
What are the boundary conditions where this hypothesis fails?
How would you know if this hypothesis is wrong?
Are the predictions specific enough to be falsifiable?
Can this hypothesis make quantitative predictions?
What would a null result look like?
Are there edge cases that violate the hypothesis?
Can you specify what evidence would count against this?
Is the hypothesis formulated precisely enough to be falsifiable?
What are the potential confounding factors?
How do you distinguish correlation from causation?
Are the predicted effects measurable?
What statistical tests would falsify this?
Can you specify confidence intervals for predictions?
What would disprove this in principle?

categories_list.name: Mechanism
questions: What is the underlying mechanism causing this effect?
Can you explain the causal chain from input to output?
What are the intermediate steps in the process?
Which components are necessary vs sufficient?
How do the parts interact to produce the whole?
What is the mathematical formulation of the mechanism?
Are there known physical/biological principles supporting this?
What energy/information transformations occur?
Can you diagram the mechanistic pathway?
What are the rate-limiting steps?
How does scale affect the mechanism?
Are there feedback loops in the system?
What controls or regulates the mechanism?
How does the mechanism respond to perturbations?
Are there multiple pathways to the same outcome?
What is the minimal mechanistic model?
How do you validate each step of the mechanism?
Are there known examples of similar mechanisms?
What assumptions about the mechanism are you making?
Can you simulate the mechanism computationally?

categories_list.name: Predictions
questions: What novel predictions does this hypothesis make?
Can you generate 5 testable predictions?
What quantitative predictions can you make?
How precise are the predictions?
What are the confidence intervals?
Do predictions vary across conditions?
What are the time-dependent predictions?
Can you predict dose-response relationships?
What emergent properties does it predict?
Are predictions monotonic or non-monotonic?
What boundary conditions affect predictions?
Can you predict failure modes?
What are the scaling predictions?
Do predictions generalize across systems?
What unexpected consequences might occur?
Can you rank predictions by confidence?
What are the necessary vs sufficient conditions for the prediction?
How do predictions change with parameter variations?
What are the limiting cases?
Can predictions be verified independently?

categories_list.name: Alternative Explanations
questions: What are 3 alternative explanations for the same observations?
How do you rule out simpler explanations (Occam's Razor)?
Could this be explained by known phenomena?
What confounding variables might produce similar results?
Is there a null hypothesis that fits the data?
Could measurement artifacts explain the effect?
Are there competing theories in the literature?
How does this compare to the current paradigm?
Could random chance produce these results?
What systematic errors could mimic this effect?
Are there hidden variables you haven't considered?
Could selection bias explain the observations?
What if the causality is reversed?
Could this be an epiphenomenon of something else?
Are there third variables causing both observations?
How do you distinguish this from noise?
Could batch effects explain the results?
What if the effect size is overestimated?
Are there publication bias concerns?
How would you test between competing hypotheses?

categories_list.name: Evidence Quality
questions: What is the quality of supporting evidence (graded A-F)?
Are there systematic reviews or meta-analyses?
What is the sample size and statistical power?
Are the methods gold-standard or exploratory?
Have results been independently replicated?
What are the confidence intervals and p-values?
Are effect sizes clinically/practically significant?
What are the sources of systematic error?
How were controls implemented?
Was blinding used appropriately?
Are there known confounders that weren't controlled?
What is the quality of data collection?
Were there pre-registered hypotheses?
How were outliers handled?
What is the signal-to-noise ratio?
Are there batch effects or technical artifacts?
How robust are findings to analytical choices?
What sensitivity analyses were performed?
Are there concerns about data integrity?
How does evidence quality compare to gold standards?

categories_list.name: Scope & Generalizability
questions: What is the domain of applicability?
Does this generalize across species/systems?
What are the boundary conditions?
How context-dependent is the effect?
Does it scale from lab to real-world?
Are there cross-cultural differences?
How does it vary across time scales?
What about different developmental stages?
Does it apply to both sexes/genders?
How does it generalize across ages?
Are there species-specific effects?
What about different environmental conditions?
How robust is it to parameter variations?
Does it hold under extreme conditions?
What is the range of validity?
Are there known exceptions?
How does it generalize across methodologies?
What about different populations?
Does it apply to pathological states?
What are the limits of extrapolation?

categories_list.name: Prior Work
questions: What does prior literature say about this?
Have similar hypotheses been tested before?
What are the seminal papers in this area?
Are there failed attempts you're building on?
What are the key findings from meta-analyses?
How does this fit with established theory?
What are the consensus views in the field?
Are there controversies you need to address?
What lessons from related fields apply?
Have negative results been published?
What are the key review papers?
How has thinking evolved over time?
What techniques have others tried?
Are there known methodological limitations?
What gaps in knowledge does this address?
How does this challenge current paradigms?
What prior assumptions are you questioning?
Are there historical precedents?
What can you learn from failures?
How thoroughly have you reviewed the literature?

categories_list.name: Experimental Design
questions: What is the optimal experimental design?
What are your independent and dependent variables?
How many conditions do you need?
What are appropriate controls?
What is the required sample size (power analysis)?
Should this be within- or between-subjects?
What about randomization and counterbalancing?
How will you handle confounds?
What blinding procedures are needed?
What are the outcome measures?
How will you validate your methods?
What are the inclusion/exclusion criteria?
Should this be cross-sectional or longitudinal?
What are the ethical considerations?
How will you ensure reproducibility?
What pre-registration is needed?
How will you handle missing data?
What quality control measures?
Should this be exploratory or confirmatory?
What pilot studies are needed first?

categories_list.name: Statistics & Analysis
categories_list.description: How will you analyze the data?
questions: What statistical tests are appropriate?
What are your null and alternative hypotheses?
What significance threshold (α)?
Should you correct for multiple comparisons?
What is your statistical power (β)?
Are parametric assumptions met?
Should you use frequentist or Bayesian stats?
What about effect sizes and confidence intervals?
How will you handle outliers?
What covariates should be included?
Should you use mixed-effects models?
What about temporal autocorrelation?
How will you assess model fit?
What sensitivity analyses are needed?
Should you use permutation tests?
What about cross-validation?
How will you report negative results?
What are the assumptions of your analysis?
Should you use robust statistics?
How will you visualize results?

categories_list.name: Reproducibility
questions: Have you provided enough methodological detail?
Are materials/reagents fully specified?
What about equipment specifications?
Have you described all procedures step-by-step?
Are data and code publicly available?
What about raw vs processed data?
Have you used version control?
Are there detailed protocols?
What documentation standards did you follow?
Have you specified all software versions?
What about random seeds for simulations?
Are there standard operating procedures?
Have you shared analysis scripts?
What quality control checks are in place?
Have independent labs attempted replication?
What are known sources of variability?
Have you documented negative results?
Are there complete data dictionaries?
What metadata is provided?
How easy would it be for others to replicate?

usage_tips.llm_optimization: Use GPT-4 or Claude for best results
usage_tips.batch_size: Process 20 questions at a time to avoid context limits
usage_tips.cost_optimization: Use GPT-3.5 for preliminary screening, GPT-4 for final validation
usage_tips.human_review: Always have domain expert review scores above 850
usage_tips.iteration: Use failed questions to improve hypothesis before re-testing
